lead_paragraph: A presentation at a trade group meeting showed that coal companies were seeing comparisons that environmentalists typically make.

headline.print_headline: Feeling Cornered, Coal Industry Borrows From Big Tobacco’s Playbook, Activists Say
headline.main: Feeling Cornered, Coal Industry Borrows From Tobacco Playbook, Activists Say

snippet: A presentation at a trade group meeting showed that coal companies were seeing comparisons that environmentalists typically make....
abstract: Environmental activist Greg Zimmerman finds internal presentation on coal industry association website that shows fossil fuel companies taking cues from tobacco industry on how to adapt to changing political climate; New York State Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman calls Zimmerman's discovery important document, saying it supports some of his own findings in efforts to determine whether Exxon Mobil has committed fraud in its public statements about climate change.
